result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Don D Hope

records.addlTxt:
9:13 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Don D Hope in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reminds the defendant of his right to counsel an inquires if he plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises as he just lost his job he planned to go to the Public Defender's office to get an attorney appointed.  Court recommends the defendant report to the Public Defender's office after court today and provides him with the PD information sheet.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel in about 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
addressed to: Don D Hope for hearing on 10/10/2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:10 PM Defendant Don D Hope in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Don D Hope. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Attorney Herbers appears as friend of the court. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court takes a short recess at 2:20 PM to allow for Mr. Marrufo to reach out to the ADA assigned to this case. Matter recalled at 2:35 PM with the same appearances. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Don D Hope
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-13-2022)
Prior: 313 Dodie Dr Apt 1, Waukesha, WI 53189
